sn35.52:1.1: The root sense of upassaṭṭha (“contaminated”) is something that has been poured upon, or on which something has been let loose (AN 5.192:8.2). Cf. Bṛhadāraṇyaka Upaniṣad 1.3.6: “They contaminated (upāsṛjan) those gods with evil”, the evil being “unfit” (apratirūpaṁ) sights, sounds, etc.
